title: GAO: Lack of Ground System Schedule Margin Adds to Likelihood of Artemis II Delay
summary: A lack of schedule margin in NASA’s Exploration Ground Systems program is adding to the likelihood that Artemis II will be delayed according to the Government Accountability Office. Scheduled for...

title: International spaceports seek to collaborate
summary: A group of existing and proposed spaceports are joining forces to share lessons learned and potentially develop standards for launch facilities around the world.

title: ESA awards contract to begin work on Ramses asteroid mission
summary: The European Space Agency signed a contract with OHB to begin work on an asteroid mission, but a decision on full funding for the mission is still more than a year away.

title: U.S. government eases export controls on space technologies
summary: The Commerce Department unveiled regulatory changes that would open new markets for U.S. companies

title: Webinar – The Rise of Intuitive Machines
summary: oin us October 29th at 1:00pm EST for a special webinar with Steve Altemus, Co-founder, President, and CEO of Intuitive Machines (IM), as he shares his vision and insights on the future of space exploration and lunar technology.

title: NRO pushes back on criticism of satellite intelligence delays
summary: The NRO's new constellation of satellites, equipped with a range of sensors, is generating more information than ever before

title: Boeing’s Starliner Delayed Again; NASA Confirms Both 2025 ISS Missions On SpaceX Crew Dragon

title: Bridenstine to Lead NASA Mars Sample Return Strategy Review
summary: In a post on NASA’s Science Mission Directorate website yesterday, NASA disclosed establishment of a Mars Sample Return Strategy Review Team to assess 11 studies of alternatives for returning samples...

title: I Am Artemis: Sarah Ryan
summary: A passion for puzzles, problem-solving, and propulsion led Sarah Ryan – a native of Columbus, Ohio – to her current position as Raptor engine lead for NASA’s HLS (Human Landing System) insight team at NASA’s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. The SpaceX Raptor rocket engine powers the company’s Starship and Super Heavy rocket. […]

title: NASA Goddard Hosts Former VP Al Gore to Mark 10 Years of DSCOVR Mission
summary: Environmentalist and former Vice President Al Gore visited NASA’s Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland, on Oct. 16, 2024, to commemorate the upcoming 10th anniversary of the DSCOVR (Deep Space Climate Observatory) mission. “The image of our Earth from space is the single most compelling iconic image that any of us have ever seen,” […]
